Description: The Mazzoni Center provides the Vivian’s Cupboard Food Bank for low-income, HIV-positive Philadelphians who are facing food insecurity. The food bank aims to help clients and patients maintain optimal health and improve the efficacy of treatment regimens by providing them with a consistent, nutritious supply of food. This program provides:- Nutritious food The food bank allows clients to select packaged food items in a pantry-style setting. Clients are provided with additional resources such as information on other local/neighborhood food cupboards and information on accessing SNAP (food stamps).Referred individuals may access the food bank two times per month and receive the equivalent of four meals for each member of their household at each visit. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Mazzoni Center has suspended the requirement that individuals need to be referred by a case manager or medical provider and have opened the food bank up to anyone in the community struggling with food insecurity.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: Philadelphia, PA.

Description:
Our Closet In Your Neighborhood (OCIYN) is a free mobile program that provides basic necessities of food and clothing, as well as access to services and benefits, to families and individuals in need. The bus visits host sites in under-resourced neighborhoods and central locations with fresh, healthy produce and pantry staples, a mini pop-up clothing shop, and an onsite social worker. 

This program provides: 

- Food
- Clothing
- Navigation services

Visitors receive fresh, locally-sourced produce and pantry staples and are welcome to shop for 10 free, quality items of clothing, shoes, and accessories per person (with a limit of 25 total per family to allow for all to receive what they need). A JFCS social worker is present at every OCIYN event to connect those in need to additional services and benefits for which they may be eligible.

OCIYN also provides customized packages of emergency clothing delivered straight to those in need, as well as food package delivery to homebound clients. 

To learn more about these services or upcoming pop-up events, contact 267-256-2179 or [email protected].
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: Philadelphia, PA.

Please call for more information.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Philadelphia County, PA.

Description: Greater Philadelphia Asian Social Service Center (GPASS) offers a food pantry site that distributes free food to residents in the Olney/Logan area and its neighboring communities.  Recipients must apply and meet eligibility requirements to receive food from the Food Program and Senior Food Box.  We do not discriminate against anyone because of sex, age, religion, ethnic or racial background, nationality, and/or physical appearance.  GPASS has the right to deny services without discrimination to an individual.This program provides:- Food to meet nutritional needsRecipients must apply and meet eligibility requirements to receive food from the Food Program. GPASS does not discriminate against anyone because of sex, age, religion, ethnic or racial background, nationality, and/or physical appearance.  GPASS has the right to deny services without discrimination to an individual.Supplies are limited, which determines the availability of these services. Clients are permitted to visit the Food Bank once per month.

Description: Green Light Pantry provides nutritious and wholesome food to Drueding Center families, graduates, staff and the local community. Since the start of the pandemic, they've had to adapt their programs to keep everyone safe by distributing pre-packaged food bags and offering virtual cooking classes.

Description:
Mady's Hands provides a variety of services to assist individuals and families gain success and stability. This program offers support, direction, and success planning through free one-on one engagement.

Located at 1952 N 24th St, Philadelphia PA, 19121.

Our services will be available for walk-in only, no appointment needed.

 Monday: 1pm-5pm
Tuesday: 1pm-5pm
Wednesday: 1pm-5pm
Thursday: By Appt. Only

Our services include the following:

Food Pantry
Nursery Pantry including Diapers, clothing and other baby items.
HIV Testing Kits (Take Home)
Clothing Bank (availability varies-please call to see if we have your size, if not we have a referral for you)

See you soon!

Description:
Feast of Justice's Community Food Cupboard provides quality food item two times per month for households experiencing food insecurity. This program supplies critical nutrition to hungry individuals and families.

This program provides:

- Food to meet basic nutritional needs

Two shopping options are provided by the Community Cupboard: Community Choice Cupboard (formally known as inside choice shopping) & our Pantry Express Pick Up. For Our Pantry Express Pick Up, participants receive a package that contains a pre-packed, large set of dry goods (based on household size), and will offer selections of produce, and meat/dairy/bread as available . Please note: guests may use each option one time per month.

Feast of Justice serves the following zip codes:
19111

Description:
On the third Wednesday of every month from 10 am to 12 pm, we host a resource fair in partnership with Esperanza Health Center. Located at 3222 H Street, the resource fair offers food, clothing, and other resources. Appointments are not necessary. 

In addition, we have a community refrigerator outside located around the corner from 3234 Potter Street on Westmoreland with fresh food available. 

Individuals who are interested in receiving updates on our events can text “FOOD” to 866-551-1675 for updates and the latest information about events, timing, and changes, or follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Philadelphia County, PA.
